actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 103-639.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 198.
Mr. Traficant moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 215 South Evans Street in Greenville, North Carolina, as the "Walter B. Jones Federal Building and United States Courthouse".

summary.text: Designates the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 215 South Evans Street in Greenville, North Carolina, as the Walter B. Jones Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To designate the Federal building and United States courthouse located at 215 South Evans Street in Greenville, North Carolina, as the "Walter B. Jones Federal Building and United States Courthouse".
